title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 332.2 - Notice of objection to bill
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 332.2 - Notice of objection to bill

State Regulations

Notice of objection by a carrier to any bill for
psychological care shall be given to the chair in duplicate, and two copies
thereof given to the psychologist whose bill is in dispute, within 30 days
after such bill has been rendered, on the form (A-1) prescribed by the chair
for such purpose. Where compensability of the claim is controverted and has not
yet been determined, or where other issues requiring Workers' Compensation

Board determination are interposed as reasons for nonpayment of the bill, the
notice of objection shall so state. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
332.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
